aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects

Class Explosion

  • java.lang.Object
    • aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects.GameObject
      • aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects.Explosion

  • public class Explosion
extends GameObject
    The Explosion class is a special kind of GameObject that spawns a Particle cloud where it is created. This effect is procedurally generated using a given integer `seed`, which is passed to the clients. This means that a certain Explosion will look exactly the same between clients.
    Author:
    qqwy

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int maxTimeUntilFadeout
      The amount of time it maximally takes for all particles to fade out (The actual fade-out time is randomized slightly per-particle to make the effect look more dynamic.)
      static int particleAmount
      The amount of particles that will spawn from a certain Explosion.

    • Field Detail

      • particleAmount

        public static int particleAmount
        The amount of particles that will spawn from a certain Explosion. `10` is a good number for reasonably beautiful and still reasonably fast explosions.

      • maxTimeUntilFadeout

        public static int maxTimeUntilFadeout
        The amount of time it maximally takes for all particles to fade out (The actual fade-out time is randomized slightly per-particle to make the effect look more dynamic.)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Explosion

        public Explosion(java.awt.geom.Point2D location,
         int seed,
         int radius,
         int colour)
        Parameters:
        location - 2d-location this Explosion should appear at
        seed - this number determines how the Explosion will look.
        radius - Used as starting-radius for the Explosion. (Larger -> Larger looking explosion)
        colour - The colour this explosion should be.

    • Method Detail

        Clones the bullet into an exact copy.

        public int getSeed()

        public long getTime()
        Returns:
        the time (in milliseconds) that have elapsed since the creationTime of this Explosion
        See Also:

      • toJSON

        public org.json.simple.JSONArray toJSON()
        Overrides:
        toJSON in class GameObject
        Returns:
        a JSONArray containing the important characteristics of this Explosion (Besides the spatial information, this is the seed, radius, colour and creationTime)
        See Also:
        GameObject.toJSON(), Explosion#fromJSON()

      • fromJSON

        public static Explosion fromJSON(org.json.simple.JSONArray json)
        Reconstructs an Explosion from the given JSONArray.
        See Also:
        toJSON()

      • isDestroyed

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Different from other GameObjects, Explosions should be destroyed after a certain amount of time.
        Therefore returns true if the Explosion is around longer than the static Explosion.maxTimeUntilFadeout
        Overrides:
        isDestroyed in class GameObject
        Returns:
        true if the object is marked for destruction, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Explosion.maxTimeUntilFadeout, GameObject.isDestroyed()

      • getColour

        public int getColour()
        Returns:
        this Explosion's current colour, in the standard sRGB colour space
        See Also:
        Color.getRGB()
